channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: From @WSJopinion: The next Republican president and GOP Congress should work to end the use of ESG principles nationwide. For the free market to thrive, it must be truly free, writes @Mike_Pence. https://t.co/3OiD787SQo

Pope Francis said he will elevate 21 men to the rank of cardinal, including a leading progressive bishop, sending a message about the pope’s wish for a more liberal orientation for the U.S. episcopate https://t.co/FvIWnhJAMc

From @WSJopinion: Nearly two years ago, I wrote in these pages, “I survived cancellation at Princeton.” I was wrong. Whoever you are and whatever your beliefs, this should terrify you, writes Joshua Katz. https://t.co/B1LccYwcvi

Janie Martinez came to the Uvalde mass that the Bidens attended with her great granddaughter, Julissa Reyna, 10, who was in the school during the shooting and escaped through a window. Biden’s visit “let us know that we’re not by ourselves,” Martinez said. https://t.co/eIAm4soKzV
The FDA is investigating two brands of organic strawberries sold at major chains including Aldi, Trader Joe’s, and Walmart that may be linked to an outbreak of hepatitis A https://t.co/8yKvJWG7gc

Toyota hopes to race with Tesla, as the world’s best-selling auto brand sends its first pure battery model to showrooms, explains @StephenWilmot #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/vazvBbyLDH https://t.co/utbAdWtUEV
George Shapiro, the talent manager and producer who helped shape some of comedy’s most memorable careers and brought “Seinfeld” to television, has died at 91 https://t.co/IylhZP88KA

The Bidens attended Mass at a church in Uvalde Sunday before meeting with the families of victims and survivors.
As the president left the church, someone yelled, “Do something," to which President Biden replied, “We will.” https://t.co/utlKMKwo57

The Justice Department said Sunday it will conduct a review of the law enforcement response in Uvalde, as requested by Mayor Don McLaughlin: “The goal of the review is to provide an independent account of law enforcement actions and responses that day." https://t.co/ROiou1O1Dz
Bridging a river under enemy fire is one of the toughest tasks any land force can face. Russia is offering the world lessons in how not to do it https://t.co/9BzX6bAdoj

President Biden and first lady Jill Biden placed flowers at the memorial at Robb Elementary School in Uvalde Sunday, joined by local officials and Texas Gov. Greg Abbott. “We need help,” a man in the crowd shouted. https://t.co/4SRzric7cg
The return-to-work rebellion is getting serious, as employees push to make their remote arrangements permanent. https://t.co/lg9ktRa2qi

“You think this can’t happen to you but it can.” Parents are increasingly alarmed about the dangers of fentanyl as overdose deaths rise, and are having difficult conversations to try and keep their kids safe. https://t.co/OBsSSnBAzI
The pope selected Bishop Robert McElroy of San Diego, one of his leading progressive allies in the U.S., among 21 men he will elevate to the rank of cardinal https://t.co/tGr5hrysQr
President Biden has arrived in Texas to meet with the families of the 19 children and two teachers who died in the mass shooting at Robb Elementary School in Uvalde https://t.co/8RsUj6Phqi

Women said they left jobs because they were not receiving enough opportunities for career progression, their personal skills were unrewarded, and their work was uninteresting. Many of those problems trace back to the same source: non-promotable work. https://t.co/2xWvxPWoys
President Biden is set to travel to Uvalde, Texas, to meet with families of victims of the mass shooting https://t.co/jyDvvgRxpp
Ukraine appealed again for more weapons from the West, as Russia intensified its push to capture key cities in the east of the country https://t.co/MNd2n48HHZ
A 20-minute drive from the Las Vegas Strip is a repository for some of the most coveted military secrets of the Cold War, known to visitors as the “petting zoo” https://t.co/KDPCFopiAY
Watch: Intermittent fasting can help improve focus and brain health for animals, studies show. We explain how some of these cognitive benefits can also apply to humans. https://t.co/drW64h36Uz

From @WSJopinion: Stakeholder capitalism imperils more than prosperity, it imperils democracy itself. ESG advocates would return society to the communal and stagnant world of the Dark Ages, write Phil Gramm and Mike Solon https://t.co/5vIenmtiJ7
The panics over satanic cults, heavy metal, Dungeons & Dragons and other perceived evils that once freaked out America have arrived in the 1980s of “Stranger Things.” https://t.co/KbmmGwZM1A
A surgeon lost his life savings. Others have given up on their dreams. All of them were swept up in crypto mania—and the crash. https://t.co/BkwP8UouKE
“People tend to be really bad at understanding percentages. Using 2.3 times rather than 130% is a way more effective way" for marketers to communicate https://t.co/CzNOk9Aaeq

Mourners by the hundreds streamed to a corner near Robb Elementary School to pay their respects to the 19 children and two teachers killed in a classroom days earlier. “These shootings are only happening here, in the United States of America.” https://t.co/AqSd4HJ5nO
Democratic Sens. Joe Manchin and Chuck Schumer are taking one more shot at crafting a scaled-back health and climate bill before the midterm elections https://t.co/Wwz57DqvwW
Real Madrid beat Liverpool to cap one of the wildest runs in Champions League history. https://t.co/RqtPekv6bB
There’s an overlooked reason why women leave jobs and are stymied in their careers: More than men, they get saddled with work that isn’t valued. https://t.co/mYCRgQaY5P

A federal judge dismissed a lawsuit from Donald Trump accusing New York Attorney General Letitia James of abusing her authority by investigating the financial affairs of his family business https://t.co/mNuMma1Ase
Three decades after its discovery, an ancient sunken ship is finally open to amateur scuba divers. And as a post-dive bonus, you can savor life on a small Greek island. https://t.co/MRYKBU9fqd

Ukraine’s forces might soon need to withdraw from the strategically important city of Severodonetsk, a Ukrainian official said, after Russian-backed troops made new advances in the battle for Donbas https://t.co/aejfmhBcw5
Kaitlyn Younger applied to five Ivy League schools, plus Stanford and Berkeley, with a 1550 on her SAT. None accepted her. https://t.co/r6iW9Xnau6

“Stranger Things” introduces Joseph Quinn as Eddie Munson, a poster boy for ‘80s-era occult paranoia. “He is both a metalhead and a dungeon master, a nerd and punk,” say the show’s creators. https://t.co/Ams2sZEKdw
Drug overdose deaths topped 100,000 in 2021, fueled by the potent synthetic opioid fentanyl. Here’s what to know about fentanyl. https://t.co/5Q0BzbF1wj
The U.K. is grappling with inflation that is at a 40-year high—above any other industrialized nation https://t.co/sSvZz40HKs
Elon Musk’s Twitter takeover comments haven’t just riled the tech company’s leaders and staff. They have also frustrated some loyal Tesla backers. https://t.co/dX1WDd74Fo
A 20-minute drive from the Las Vegas Strip is a repository for some of the most coveted military secrets of the Cold War, known to visitors as the "petting zoo" https://t.co/g5rYYajLNb
For the first time, scientists have identified the entire genetic makeup of a victim of the deadly Mount Vesuvius eruption nearly 2,000 years ago https://t.co/vS9IQhnMyF
Ukrainian authorities are struggling to balance the desire to show the world how Russian troops are treating civilians with the need to preserve evidence for trial https://t.co/w2JzKIBqsQ
Take a look at the front page of today's Wall Street Journal https://t.co/61fT9d3Mmu https://t.co/XSz1zmdP7C
A financial revolution is gripping India—where even beggars take donations via apps https://t.co/Wy72QMvDzR
Starbucks joins McDonald’s and other Western companies as it is set to close its business in Russia following Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/oScVQPkRIP
The Justice Department won’t charge FBI agents who disregarded Olympic gymnasts’ complaints of sexual assault by Larry Nassar and lied to cover their mistakes https://t.co/xWjQl0gg1V
The number of U.S. residents in Portugal climbed by 45% last year. Here's what to know about why so many Americans are making the country their home base. https://t.co/jOsSKGgthD

Review: “Top Gun: Maverick” is half videogame, half car commercial, which may be exactly what audiences want from their big-screen experience now—frictionless storytelling with special effects. https://t.co/JuI2jH9LsG

Ukraine is accusing Russia of using thermobaric weapons—whose powerful blasts can unleash a devastating toll on people and buildings—in the latest battle for the Donbas area of eastern Ukraine https://t.co/xEcwHNW4ig
"Top Gun: Maverick" proved too pro-American for one Chinese investor, which backed out of the film amid mounting U.S.-China tensions https://t.co/Ti5tiQ2Fyu

From @WSJopinion: Nearly two years ago, I wrote in these pages, “I survived cancellation at Princeton.” I was wrong. Whoever you are and whatever your beliefs, this should terrify you, writes Joshua Katz https://t.co/uQUQaFhnDc

Shampoos and shower gels contain up to 95% water—and lots of other products are mostly water. Manufacturers, spurred in part by sustainability concerns, are removing the water in shampoos and lotions, and selling them as powders. https://t.co/CCVNaYkj8U
Here is an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal's weekend edition https://t.co/35nmrRU55w https://t.co/MVGyiCgBtd
